entry.title: Custodia Bank Loses Claim To A Fed Master Account Following Court Ruling â€“ Details
entry.summary:
A United States judge has ruled against Custodia Bankâ€™s claim to membership and a master account with the Federal Reserve. The digital asset bank had initially sued the Fed in 2022 for delaying a decision on whether or not to grant the bank a master account.
Interestingly, the Federal Reserve rejected the bankâ€™s membership and master account applications in January 2023. This move came after confirming Custodiaâ€™s eligibility to submit these requests to the US central banking system.
Why Custodia Bank Applied For Fed Master Account And Membership
On Friday, March 29, Judge Scott Skavdahl rejected Custodia Bankâ€™s bid to obtain a Federal Reserve master account, according to a filing submitted to the United States District Court of Wyoming.Â
The master account is referred to as â€œa bankâ€¦

entry.title: UK Judge Freezes $7.6M Of Craig Wright Assets In Bitcoin Authorship Trial
entry.summary:
The world had all eyes on the trial between Craig Wright and the Crypto Open Patent Alliance (COPA) that determined whether the Australian computer scientist was Bitcoinâ€™s creator, Satoshi Nakamoto.
Now that the trial has concluded, a UK Judge granted a Worldwide Freezing Order (WFO) of $7.6 million in Wrightâ€™s assets. The decision was issued due to the high avoidance risk of the caseâ€™s payment costs.
Bitcoinâ€™s Creator Could Be Anyone, Itâ€™s Just Not Wright
Craig Wrightâ€™s claims started in 2016 when he began to assert that he was behind the pseudonym identity of Satoshi Nakamoto. For years, these claims remained unproven and highly contested by the crypto community.
Wright faced several legal battles over his attempts to prove authorship of Bitcoin and to copyright BTCâ€™s whitepapeâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin Sharks Show Biggest Monthly Buying Spree Since 2012
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin shark cohort has participated in its largest accumulation spree over the past month since 2012.
Bitcoin Sharks Have Purchased More Than 268,000 BTC In The Last Month
As analyst James Van Straten explains in a new post on X, Bitcoin entities holding between 100 andÂ 1,000 BTC have made some large net buying moves in the past month.
An â€œentityâ€ here refers to a collection of addresses owned by the same investor as determined through analysis by the on-chain analytics firm Glassnode.
The entities holding between 100 to 1,000 BTC are popularly known as â€œsharks.â€ At the current exchange rate of the asset, this range converts to about $6.93 million to $69.3 million.
Thus, the investors carrying these amounts are clearly quite big, meaning that they shouâ€¦

entry.title: Crypto Open Interest At All-Time High: Explosive Move Incoming?
entry.summary:
Data shows the total open interest in the crypto sector has recently been at an all-time high, indicating that volatility may be coming for the coins.
Crypto Open Interest Has Been At Extreme Levels Recently
As CryptoQuant Netherlands community manager Maartunn pointed out in a post on X, the total crypto open interest has recently been sitting around a whopping $51.3 billion.
The â€œopen interestâ€ here refers to the total amount of derivative positions related to all digital assets currently open on the various exchanges in the sector.
When the value of this metric rises, it means that the investors are opening up fresh positions on the market right now. Generally, the total leverage in the sector goes up when such a trend takes form, so the assets could become more likely to showâ€¦

entry.title: Bitmain Launches Antminer S21 Pro, Its Most Advanced Bitcoin Miner
entry.summary:
Today, one of the largest Bitcoin mining rig manufacturers, Bitmain, announced the launch of the Antminer S21 Pro at the Global Digital Mining Summit (WDMS) 2024, an event the company hosts.
ðŸ’¥ANTMINER S21 Pro Newly Launched â—ï¸234T â—ï¸15.0J/T ðŸ“ˆCreate a New Level of Hashrate pic.twitter.com/wZyUv7pbOQ â€” BITMAIN (@BITMAINtech) March 29, 2024
The new device, an improvement upon itsÂ most efficient mining rig, the S21, is notably more efficientâ€”and powerfulâ€”than the previous iteration of the device. Irene Gao, VP of Mining at Bitmain, highlighted in her announcement how the Antminer S21 Pro has a hash rate of 234 TH/s and an energy efficiency ratio of 15.0 J/TH. In contrast, the Antminer S21 has a hash rate of 200 TH/s and a power consumption efficiency ratio of 17.5 J/TH. Gao also highlighted how durable the S21 Pro is. "It has the ability to deal with more challenging environments," she said, before sharing that the device can withstand temperatures of up to 45 degrees Celsius (113 degrees Fahrenheit). The after coupon U.S. dollar to terahash rate for the device is $18.9/TH and Bitmain will begin shipping the device in Q3 2024. This announcement comes justÂ seven months after Bitmain launchedÂ the S21. The S21 was quickly adopted by Bitcoin miners, as it has alreadyÂ sold out via the company's website.
Bitmain no longer has Antminer S21 mining devices in stock.
"We truly believe this new product will be helpful for you to make your long-term plans for your mining expansion, especially before the new cycle," added Gao. For more information on the Antminer S21 Pro, keep an eye out for updates on Bitmain's website.

entry.title: BITCOIN HITS $72,000!
entry.summary: BTC hits new ATH of $72k, flips Silver market cap. Wick lower then higher causes $350m liquidations. London Stock Exchange to consider crypto ETNs. Funding again soars before ETF buying begins. Crypto saw record $2.7bn inflows last week. MicroStrategy buys another $821m of BTC.

entry.title: BTC HITS 70K!
entry.summary: ETF net inflows hit $472m in strong week. GBTC outflows hit $10bn, nearly overtaken by new 9. BlackRock to allow more funds to buy BTC ETFs. Rumours still of Qatar buying amid Bukele meeting.

entry.title: Live With Raoul Pal
entry.summary: SOL up 10%, Pantera raising $250m to buy from FTX. Market flat but spot buyers begin to drive volumes.

entry.title: Streamlining Blockchain: Demystifying Real-Time Insights & Simplifying Data Management

This webinar, guided by our seasoned experts Nick Yushkevich and Carl DiClementi, provides you with actionable insights into tackling common challenges faced by businesses in the blockchain space. From real-time data streaming that ensures timely decision-making to robust error handling mechanisms that guarantee data integrity, and comprehensive observability features that offer deep insights into your blockchain operations, weâ€™ll cover how QuickNodeâ€™s infrastructure is tailored to enhance operational efficiency, scalability, and innovation.

entry.title: DOGS ON TOP!
entry.summary: ETFs see another $562m net inflow. Fear & Greed hits 90, was above for months in 2021. ETH leads majors, beta-plays take lead in altcoins. BlackRock to start buying BTC in its largest fund. MicroStrategy plans $600m capital raise to buy BTC. BTC flips market cap of Silver. WIF to be listed on Binance, rises 20%. PEPE & WIF mentioned on Bloomberg. Alien Punk sells for $16m, â€˜NFTs not deadâ€™. 3 more large NFT sales for $500K.

entry.title: Interview: How SocialFi Will Transform Crypto Farming Game 'Pixels'
entry.summary: Pixels founder Luke Barwikowski joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss how the Ronin-based farming game will be transformed through the addition of guilds and changes to resource generation. They also discuss his ultimate vision for Pixels and his team. Note: This interview was recorded shortly before the PIXEL token launch.
